data.title: Valley Hometown Check Cashing Policy
data.text:
Valley Hometown Market, Inc. will accept a personal check as payment for the amount of the order only (No cash back).

Valley Hometown, Inc. does NOT cash checks.

When using a check the customer must present a valid (not expired) photo driver’s license or PA photo ID card.

There is no way to use a check without presenting a valid ID.

The customer’s name must be on the check.

The name on the check must match the name on the photo ID.

The cashier will record a valid phone number and ID number on the front of the check.

All checks must be signed in the checker’s presence.

All checks for orders over $75.00 must be approved and initialed by the person in charge.

The maximum check that can be used is $250.00.

Customers cannot use more than three checks per week.

Customers cannot use more than one check per day.

Customers may cash “Rebate Checks” for $20.00 or less and must go toward the payment of an order.

Valley Hometown Market will NOT accept the following:

Payroll checks; Altered checks; Post-dated checks

Two party checks; Out of town checks; Home-printed checks

Checks for cash back; Money Orders; Traveler’s checks

Income tax checks; Checks drawn on a foreign bank; Insurance checks

Starter checks (defined: check with no name or check with a number less than 300)

Returned checks for insufficient or uncollected funds will be charged $50 service fee and the original payment amount.

Valley Hometown, Inc. reserves the right to refuse to accept any check for any reason.
